forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5am. Cloudy, with a low around 54. South wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 11am. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The early hours of the morning in Downtown San Francisco wrap the city in a shroud of clouds, hinting at the rain that the forecast promisingly suggests will arrive before the sun has fully taken its stand. A cool breeze whispers through the streets, delivering a sensation of chill that pervades the damp air, with temperatures settling around a mild 54 degrees. As this gray blanket covers the skyline, one may catch glimpses of the Golden Gate Bridge barely outlined in the distance, the iconic span wrestling with the burgeoning fog. 

As the day unfolds, expect the rain to sweep in, likely wrapping the city in a curtain of water until late morning, after which the skies may reluctantly part to reveal patches of sunlight. Even so, the high will hover just shy of 60 degrees, dropping slightly as the afternoon stretches on. With southwest winds gusting up to 31 mph, it may feel quite brisk, adding an edge to the air that beckons for layers. A sturdy jacket or windbreaker, perhaps paired with an umbrella, would be wise choices for anyone venturing outside, as the chance of precipitation lingers throughout the day. Activities could lean towards warming comforts; perhaps scouring a cozy café, diving into a new book amid the soothing sounds of nearby raindrops, or exploring an art space where creativity reigns over the weather's whims. The city, even under clouds, harbors the promise of quiet, contemplative enjoyment as winter’s gentle embrace solidifies its hold.
